summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingBYOMA Sensitive Retinol Oil is an ultra-soothing, lightweight oil that absorbs quickly into skin, working to nourish the skin barrier while visibly improving skin's tone and texture.
details: DetailsBenefitsOil-based retinol for sensitive skin and first time usersAll the benefits of a retinol with none of the drawbacksConsistent use results in softening the appearance of fine lines, blemishes, and pores, while brightening dark spots and evening skin tone.Dermatologist tested & approved skincareAlcohol & fragrance-freeRecyclable bottlesClinically proven to reduce fine lines + wrinklesClinically proven to reduce skin sensitivityClinically proven to protect and maintain the skin barrierFeaturesFormulated with Barrier Lipids, Hydroxypinacolone Retinoate (Vitamin A) and Squalane, this lightweight oil supports a healthy microbiome by safeguarding the skin barrierKey IngredientsBarrier Lipids that help restore skin barrierHydroxypinacolone Retinoate (Vitamin A) and Squalane improve skin's tone and texture without strippingItem 2620411How To UseApply 4-6 drops as part of your PM skincare routine, gently pressing until fully absorbed. Start out slow (2-3 nights per week) and increase usage as tolerance builds. Store in a cool, dark place.Precautions: Eye irritation.IngredientsCetyl Ethylhexanote, Squalane, Glycine Soja (Soybean) Oil, Dimethyl Isosorbid, Hydroxypinacolone Retinoate, Tocopherol, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Daucus Carota Sativa (Carrot) Seed Oil, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Bisabolol, Magnolia Officinalis Bark Extract, Camellia Oleifera Seed Oil.
how_to_use: Apply 4-6 drops as part of your PM skincare routine, gently pressing until fully absorbed. Start out slow (2-3 nights per week) and increase usage as tolerance builds. Store in a cool, dark place.Precautions: Eye irritation.

reviews.headline: Burned
reviews.comments: This is not a sensitive form of retinol. This serum burned my skin.  Instant return.

reviews.headline: A great retinol starter
reviews.comments: I'm new to using Retinol, and I'm so happy I started off with this one. It doesn't irritate my skin at all. I prefer to put 4 drop on the palm of my hands and pat it on. For me, it's to oily to drop on my face and then rub, I got it in my eye 2 times when I tried doing it that way, so I don't recommend applying it that way.

reviews.headline: I like the product.  However,
reviews.comments:
I like the product, overall. This is the first retinol product I've tried. I have rosacea, and started using this product every 2 nights for a few weeks. Then, moved to every other night for a few more weeks, before using  it every night for the last several weeks. I also have dry skin.  So, the oil formula is nice for me.  I have noticed some modest changes in tone and sensitivity since starting this product.  
I removed a star when I read the answer to a customer-submitted question about the percentage (dose or strength) of retinol in the product.  (I was searching for this answer, as well.  I wanted to start researching what I could step up to next, which is normal for retinol use.)The answer provided by Byoma cited that it would be "giving away secrets" if they were to disclose this information.  This is untrue.  Many other companies list the strength of the retinol products right on the front of their packaging, and others on the back, or they provide it online.  This is important information to have with retinol use.  (Compare it to a company marketing a sunblock, but refusing to tell you the SPF, as it's a "secret".)
I removed another star when I realized that this is just a ploy to get you to continue to use their product, because even though they market it as "beginner and sensitive-friendly," they don't give you the information you would need (the strength) to be able to make an informed decision about your skin after you've completed a cycle with this product, and are ready to step-up.
Unfortunately, I use quite a few Byoma products, and they have been great for my skin, but I don't knowingly do business with companies who are not transparent with important information.  I DO have a right to know not only what I am putting on my skin, but in this case, the strength.  I will be finding replacements for all of the Byoma products I use.  This disappoints me.

reviews.headline: I like it
reviews.comments: Definitely isnt bad. I had some acne scars on my skin and i can really see a difference in the redness. Howver if you have a ton of redness i would spring for something a little more powerfull.

reviews.headline: Works Well but doesn't absorb
reviews.comments: I don't want to be the person who says the oil is too oily but it is. This product works well, especially if my skin is dry, but doesn't absorb well. I have to use the smallest amount otherwise it gets all over my pillows and sleep bonnet. It works really good for starter retinol.

reviews.headline: So far so good
reviews.comments: So far I like it, my face is going through the normal cycles of starting retinol so it's doing the job.

reviews.headline: Actually reduced redness
reviews.comments: I have extremely sensitive skin and this is the first retinol I have used that actually reduced skin irriatation. I've noticed improvement in my hyperpigmentation and keratosis after using it 3 nights a week for about 3 months. The oil is very light weight and has almost no scent. This would be a great retinol for a beginner. This is gentle enough that I think it could be used every night. I would apply a light weight moisturizer before the oil to avoid irriation.

reviews.headline: Actually reduced redness
reviews.comments: I have extremely sensitive skin and this is the first retinol I have used that actually reduced skin irriatation. I've noticed improvement in my hyperpigmentation and keratosis after using it 3 nights a week for about 3 months. The oil is very light weight and has almost no scent. This would be a great retinol for a beginner. This is gentle enough that I think it could be used every night. I would apply a light weight moisturizer before the oil to avoid irriation.

reviews.headline: Finally!  A product for  skin that really is
reviews.comments:
Not sure if this is actually doing any snti aging yet or not.  However this has calmed my easily irritated skin, made my skin softer, more supple and smooth.  My skin fees moisturized and stays moisturized throughout the day.  Huge win for my menopausal dry sensitive skin! 

I started slow in case it irritated my skin.  Its gentle enough to use every other day possibly daily.  

Hope Byoma makes this forever and necer changes the formula!!

reviews.headline: Great product
reviews.comments:
I love this product! Seeing results at a timely rate and my skin isn't irritated like it is when I use other retinols. 
My skin is brighter, my acne is better and my pores are reduced. 
So glad that i found this!

reviews.headline: Retinol Oil
reviews.comments: Does not absorb well.

reviews.headline: I like it a lot!
reviews.comments: This was surprisingly more gentle than I thought! I have pretty sensitive skin so I was a little nervous trying it out but I always wanted to find a retinol that I can use once a week! This I can definitely use once a week and if you have less sensitive skin then probably more than once a week! It was gifted to me by byoma but I Highly recommend giving it a shot I'm happy with the results so far!

reviews.headline: Wonder potion
reviews.comments:
Gifted by Byoma

First of all thank you Byoma for gifting me this for free.

This serum was a wonder after getting my skin super dry from the sun on my trip. A little drop at nite was the trick that my skin needed. My skin tone has even out and my skin looks brighter which I absolutly love.  Thanks to vitamin A and squalane i could say my skin is on its way to 100%

reviews.headline: Loving this!
reviews.comments: I received this retinol oil complimentary from Byoma in exchange for my honest review of the product. This is the most gentle retinol experience I've had in a long time. I have pretty sensitive skin but I did not experience any redness or excessive dryness or peeling. The oil is not greasy, which was a happy surprise. So far, I'm loving this product. Can't wait to try more from this brand!

reviews.headline: Great retinol for a great price
reviews.comments: I have had the Byoma Sensitive Retinol Oil for about a month now. Every Byoma product I've ever tried has been amazing and this retinol is no different!! I love the sensitive skin formula since retinol can typically be too harsh for skin. The oil has no weird/funky smell and is lightweight and super easy to apply. Also, love the price point for this retinol. Will continue to use on my face, neck and back of hands! Gifted by Byoma

reviews.headline: Gentle
reviews.comments: This gentle, lightweight oil with retinol is perfect for sensitive skin. It absorbs quickly without irritation, leaving my skin feeling smooth and hydrated. I've noticed a significant improvement in texture and radiance. Gifted by BYOMA

reviews.headline: I like it a lot so far!
reviews.comments: I received this Sensitive Retinol Oil to try out and review complimentary from Byoma Skincare in exchange for my honest opinion. I have been really liking this facial oil so far. It's been gentle on my skin without causing any irritation, and I think that it has been making my skin look a bit brighter since I started using it. It might be too soon to tell but I think maybe it's also been helping with improving my skin's texture too. I also like that this face oil is vegan and made of clean ingredients. I'm looking forward to hopefully seeing more positive long-term effects to my skin with continued use of this retinol oil.

reviews.headline: My skin is loving this
reviews.comments: Gifted by byoma, this Sensitive Retinol Oil is wonderful. My skin looks healthy, hydrated and fresh after using this. I wasn't sure about a retinol oil but I really enjoy this. Has helped with textural issues and is slowly helping with fine lines.

reviews.headline: Great for sensitive skin
reviews.comments: This is a great option for anyone that's new or sensitive to retinol, especially if you have dry skin! I love that it comes in an oil form factor. It feels like a great one and done product to nourish my skin while also getting my retinol. Gifted by byoma

reviews.headline: Very nice
reviews.comments: Extremely gentle! The squalane makes this retinol very hydrating unlike other serums I have tried. It really appeals to my sensitive skin and allows me to use retinol without the risk of damaging my skin. Gifted by Byoma

media.headline: Absolutly perfect for those with sensitive skin!
Gentle but I see good results
Must have as part of night routine
media.caption: Nightly routine

media.headline: I think I would have it again.
Fabulous Retinol Oil for Sensitive Skin
media.caption: Ingredients right on the bottle

media.headline: Good for first time retinol users

faceoff_positive.comments: As someone with dry, sensitive skin, I'm always cautious when introducing retinol into my routine. The Byoma Sensitive Retinol Oil has been a game-changer for me. This oil is specifically formulated for sensitive skin, and it truly delivers on its promise. From the first use, I noticed how gentle it is. There was no irritation, redness, or peeling, which is rare for a retinol product. The oil has a lightweight texture that absorbs quickly into the skin without leaving a greasy residue. It's deeply hydrating, which is a must for my dry skin, and it leaves my face feeling soft and nourished. After a few weeks of consistent use, I started to see a difference in my skin's texture. It looks smoother, and some fine lines are less noticeable. The best part is that I can enjoy these benefits without worrying about my skin reacting negatively. If you have sensitive skin and have been hesitant to try retinol, I highly recommend giving Byoma Sensitive Retinol Oil a try. It's a gentle yet effective way to incorporate retinol into your skincare routine. Gifted by byoma
